intro: Calistachya alba, commonly known as the white calistachy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It has hairy, lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing small, round seeds. Calistachya alba is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
